channel.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
channel.description:
So i have a 1998 Chevy S10 and I'm thinking about doing the following:
Air Intake: Cold Air Intake Turbo or Super Charge (Idk which one is better for horse power) Change car from all wheel to 4 wheel drive Engine: I don't know yet Automatic to Manual Dual Exhaust (special mod for flames out the Exhaust) Increasing Air Intake 22 inch rims (black) New body kit paint job: Black and purple mix Hydrolics, Bags, lower: (I don't know if i wanna do any of these because i dont wanna mess up my suspension) Suicide, Lambo, Butter fly (I want opinions on which one would look the best, im thinking suicide but i want opinions) Replace back window with one that can open and make a bed that attaches to the cab and add subs and base in trunk Interior: Black Leather
can anyone give me their opinions on what would be best for horsepower on this truck, thank you.

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:306684”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=402854.msg3040706#msg3040706 date=1259097200]

Dual Exhaust (special mod for flames out the Exhaust)

This made me lol hard.
[/quote]

You can actually do it by putting spark plugs towards the end of your exhaust and wire them to a coil that is turned on and off by a switch or button you can push. This will ignite the unburned gas and shoot out flames, don’t have a good paint job though because it will just torch it off.

I would never do this personally, I just know how it’s done.[/quote]

It works better with stacks.

Read full topic

[/quote]

You can actually do it by putting spark plugs towards the end of your exhaust and wire them to a coil that is turned on and off by a switch or button you can push. This will ignite the unburned gas and shoot out flames, don’t have a good paint job though because it will just torch it off.

I would never do this personally, I just know how it’s done.

can anyone give me their opinions on what would be best for horsepower on this truck, thank you.[/quote]

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“TheBeanie, post:9, topic:306684”]Difference between a supercharger and a turbocharger:

Turbo: Requires a certain ammount of RPM before it kicks in, Known as “turbo lag”… Its connected to the exhaust.

Supercharger = doesnt… it works right from when you put foot down… = doesnt experiance turbo lag…[/quote]

You didn’t explain why. Both a supercharger and a turbocharger are forced air induction. This is opposite to a car that is naturally aspirated. A turbocharger operates off of exhaust gases, using the force of the exhaust air to spin a turbine forcing air back into the intake manifold. Waiting for this turbine to ‘spin up’ is the cause of so-called ‘turbo lag’. A supercharger operates via a belt or a chain (usually a cogged belt) connected to the crankshaft, which is what the pistons turn in your engine, therefore whenever your engine is running it is spinning and operating the supercharger, which again forces air into your engine. Superchargers give you more low-end torque compared to turbochargers which give you more high-end torque.

If you are curious why I didn’t mention horse power (HP), it is simply because it is mathematically calculated with this simple formula:
Horse Power = RPM * Torque

Read full topic

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Difference between a supercharger and a turbocharger:

Turbo: Requires a certain ammount of RPM before it kicks in, Known as “turbo lag”… Its connected to the exhaust.

Supercharger = doesnt… it works right from when you put foot down… = doesnt experiance turbo lag…

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:7, topic:306684”]Did you play to much Need For Speed?
Seriously, you are trying to do something that will cost you allot… And you would need to know what you’re doing, which you give me the impression you aren’t.

As for the engine, swap a HEMI in it, or a big block atleast V8 like Travis implies.
To turbo/supercharge… What kind of power are you looking for?
A supercharger would be more suited for a V8 engine with a big displacement.
Because with a supercharger you have instant power from idle RPM.
With the turbo charger it has to spool up in order to deliver any power, which could give you a very narrow power band.[/quote]

Swapping in a Big block would be a complete nightmare, doable, just not at all easy. A small block V8 like I swapped in though is practically a bolt-in replacement. (350ci is what mine is, you could get a stock pontiac 400 small block to work too, or if you have a lot of money you can get a 454ci small block crate engine to put in it)

Read full topic

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

Did you play to much Need For Speed?
Seriously, you are trying to do something that will cost you allot… And you would need to know what you’re doing, which you give me the impression you aren’t.

As for the engine, swap a HEMI in it, or a big block atleast V8 like Travis implies.
To turbo/supercharge… What kind of power are you looking for?
A supercharger would be more suited for a V8 engine with a big displacement.
Because with a supercharger you have instant power from idle RPM.
With the turbo charger it has to spool up in order to deliver any power, which could give you a very narrow power band.

Read full topic

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

My buddy has a '99 Chevy S10. Its bagged, CAI, Swapped a v4 and manual transmission, JVC HU and 12" memphis in a pro box powered by a 1000 watt class d monoblock memphis amp, And i’m pretty sure it has a cherry bomb exhaust and 18" rims. But because of the bags, it goes out of alignment all the time, and its great around town, but on the interstate it sucks dick to ride in… But its also a show truck… Oh yeh, its an extreme, with the front bumper and side skirts, but it has a rollpan on the back, and shaved handles all the way around…

Read full topic

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What kind of engine is it in right now? A 4.3 V6 or something else? If it is a 4.3 V6 then it is almost trivial to drop a 350 V8 in there just like I did when my engine blew at 314,000 miles. That would be my first move I guess, unless you want to install a good stereo system first.

Read full topic

item.title: Truck Upgrade? 98 S10
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

runescape3dude:

is all wheel not 4wd?

yes

AWD = tires can have different amounts of power applied to them

4wd = same amount of power goes into each tire
